feed.title: NewsTracker: cyclone or volcano
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Great Barrier Reef braces for cyclone hit
entry.summary: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk said up to 9,000 people could be directly in the path of the cyclone by the time it builds to category four strength, the second highest level.

entry.title: Cyclone Marcia: Climate change is expanding the tropics
entry.summary: Queensland residents and authorities are rushing to prepare as Cyclone Marcia intensifies and makes her presence felt.

entry.title: Volcano erupts for third time in 8 days
entry.summary: The volcano has not erupted since 1961.

entry.title: Ex-cyclone to cause wild weather in NT
entry.summary:
After two evacuations in one month, a Goulburn Island resident is calling on the Northern Territory government to invest in a cyclone shelter in the community.

All 427 of the island's residents were flown to Darwin for four days in February as category 4 Cyclone Lam bore down, and again for two days this week as category 2 Cyclone Nathan approached, which was forecast to intensify to a category 3.

entry.title: Half of Vanuatu's population affected by Cyclone Pam: UN
entry.summary:
More than half of the South Pacific island nation Vanuatu's population has been affected by Cyclone Pam, the UN said Saturday as the death toll rose to 16.

"Around 166,000 people, more than half of Vanuatu's population, have been affected by Tropical Cyclone Pam on 22 islands," the Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said in a situation report.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Australia gives Vanuatu $5 million in aid
entry.summary: Cyclone Pam left a trail of devastation across the Pacific island nation on Saturday, with 250 km/h winds levelling entire villages in the capital, Port Vila.

entry.title: Thousands flee after volcano erupts in Chile
entry.summary: Chilean authorities had issued an orange alert Monday because of increased activity at the volcano.

entry.title: Indonesia Raises Alert Status of Volcano to Highest Level
entry.summary: The volcano had been dormant for four centuries before springing to life in August 2010, killing two people and forcing 30,000 to flee.

entry.title: Indonesia raises alert status of volcano to highest level
entry.summary:
JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) " Indonesia has raised the alert status of Sinabung volcano in the western part of the country to the highest level following a sharp increase in activity, an official said Wednesday.

The volcano's status was raised to the highest alert level before midnight Tuesday, said national disaster management agency spokesman Sutopo Purwo Nugroho.

He said the volcano's increased activity the past two days had made it unstable.

entry.title: Temporary houses for NT cyclone victims
entry.summary: Almost four months after Cyclone Lam destroyed homes in Galiwinku community on the NT's Elcho Island, families have been moved into the first lot of temporary transportable houses.

entry.title: Boat carrying more than 450 people sinks in Yangtze River
entry.summary: The official Xinhua News Agency quoted the captain and chief engineer, who were both rescued, as saying the ship sank quickly after being caught in a cyclone.

entry.title: Boat with more than 450 people sinks in China's Yangtze
entry.summary: BEIJING (AP) - A yacht carrying more than 450 people sank overnight in the Yangtze River during a cyclone in southern China, and eight people have been rescued, the state broadcaster CCTV reported Tuesday.

entry.title: Volcano erupts in southern Japan, spewing ash high into sky
entry.summary: Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe announces governmental response to an eruption of a volcano in southern Japan, at his official residence in Tokyo Friday, May 29, 2015.

entry.title: Volcano Erupts in Southern Japan, Spewing Ash High Into Sky
entry.summary: A volcano erupted in spectacular fashion on a small island in southern Japan on Friday, spewing out rocks and sending black clouds of ash 9 kilometers (5.6 miles) into the sky.

entry.title: Japan's Mount Shindake erupts suddenly
entry.summary: The volcano erupted suddenly on Friday, blasting plumes of black smoke high into the sky, prompting authorities to order the evacuation of the island's residents and forcing airlines to divert some flights.

entry.title: Mount Shindake volcano erupts, Japan calls for evacuation
entry.summary: Sadayuki Kitagawa, director of volcanology division at Japan Meteorological Agency, speaks after a volcano erupted on a small island in southern Japan.

entry.title: Japan's Mount Shindake volcano erupts
Volcano erupts on Japanese island, evacuation ordered and flights diverted
entry.summary:
The company said an internal analysis showed the erupting volcano posed no risk to the Sendai plant on Kyushu island, and volcanologists agreed.

"Even a large eruption on the island won't pose a risk to the Sendai plant," said Setsuya Nakada, a professor at Tokyo University's Volcano Research Centre.

entry.title: Volcano erupts on southern Japanese island
entry.summary: The eruption last September of another volcano, Mount Ontake in central Japan, killed 57 people.

entry.title: Volcano erupts on southern Japanese island
entry.summary: The Japan Meterological Agency raised the volcano alert level to five, the highest on its scale.

entry.title: Japanese Volcano Mount Shindake Erupts On Kuchinoerabu Island
entry.summary: No injuries had been reported, although the Japan Meteorological Agency reported that pyroclastic flows from the volcano had reached the shore to the northwest.

entry.title: Volcano erupts on southern Japanese island
entry.summary: TOKYO (AP) - A volcano erupted on a small island in southern Japan on Friday, and authorities ordered residents to evacuate the island.

entry.title: Volcano Erupts on Small Southern Japanese Island; Residents Urged to Evacuate
Galapagos Island volcano erupts first time in 33 years
entry.summary:
In this photo provided by Diego Paredes, guide of La Pinta Yatch Expedition, shows Wolf volcano erupting, at Isabela Island, Galapagos Islands, Ecuador, Monday, May 25, 2015.

The volcano located on the northern tip of Isabela Island, erupted after 33 years of inactivity, but without jeopardizing human populations, tourism operations and fauna of this area, at the world famous Galapagos archipelago.

entry.title: Galapagos Island Volcano Erupts First Time in 33 Years
entry.summary: The volcano lies on the northern tip of Isabela Island, the archipelago's largest.

entry.title: Volcano erupts in Galapagos Islands, home to unique pink iguanas
entry.summary: The lava is flowing down the volcano's southern face while the iguanas, officially an endangered species, inhabit the opposite side, the Environment Ministry said in a statement, adding it expected the animals to escape harm.

entry.title: Galapagos Island volcano erupts after 33 years, threatening fragile ecosystem
entry.summary:
QUITO, Ecuador - A volcano atop one of the Galapagos Islands has erupted for the first time in 33 years, threatening a fragile ecosystem that inspired Charles Darwin's theory of evolution.

Ecuador's Galapagos National Park administration said the mile-high (1.7 kilometer-high) Wolf volcano began spewing fire, smoke and lava before dawn Monday.

entry.title: Volcano erupts on Galapagos island home to unique pink iguanas
entry.summary: The park posted pictures showing lava pouring down the sides of the Wolf volcano, the Galapagos' highest point, while dark plume billowed overhead.

entry.title: Volcano erupts on Galapagos island home to unique pink iguanas
entry.summary:
QUITO A volcano perched atop one of Ecuador's Galapagos islands erupted in the early hours of Monday, the National Park said, potentially threatening a unique species of pink iguanas.

"The Wolf volcano is not located near a populated area. There is not risk for the human population. This is the only population of pink iguanas in the world," The Galapagos National Park said on Twitter.

In April, unusual activity was also reported at the Sierra volcano on the same Isabela island, the archipelago's biggest, where yellow iguanas and giant turtles also live.

entry.title: Scientists watching Hawaii's Kilauea Volcano for new eruption
entry.summary:
Scientists are closely watching a volcano on Hawaii's Big Island for a possible eruption after volatile changes in the level of a lake of lava on its summit and a series of earthquakes, the U.S. Geological Survey said on Monday.

An eruption in the Southwest Rift Zone would not pose a risk to people because that side of the volcano is not inhabited.

entry.title: Earthquakes on Hawaii volcano could signal new eruption
entry.summary: In this Saturday, May 9, 2015 photo, molten rock lights up the night as it spews into a lake of lava near the summit of Kilauea volcano on Hawaii's Big Island.

entry.title: Earthquakes on Hawaii volcano could signal new eruption
entry.summary:
Meanwhile, a rash of earthquakes rattled the volcano with as many as 20 to 25 quakes per hour, and scientists' tilt meters detected that the ground was deforming.

"Clearly the lava, by dropping out of sight, it has to be going somewhere," said Steven Brantley, deputy scientist in charge of Hawaiian Volcano Observatory of the U.S. Geological Survey.

entry.title: Earthquakes on Hawaii volcano could signal new eruption
entry.summary: The earthquake activity had slowed Saturday morning, and scientists were continuing to watch the volcano closely, Brantley said.

entry.title: Earthquakes on Hawaii volcano could signal new eruption
entry.summary:
Meanwhile, a rash of earthquakes rattled the volcano with as many as 20 to 25 quakes per hour.

Volcano scientist Steve Brantley says the lava has been dropping out of sight, and it has to be going somewhere.

entry.title: Earthquakes on Hawaii volcano could signal new eruption
Tourists caught out as Nicaragua volcano erupts in front of their eyes
entry.summary: This is the incredible moment a volcano erupts in Nicaragua - but the tourists standing right by it carry on filming even as a huge plume of smoke and ash fills the air.

entry.title: Philippine volcano ejects ash, but no violent eruption
entry.summary: MANILA, Philippines (AP) - A Philippine volcano has spewed ash for the second time in less than a week but there were no signs of any eminent violent eruption, the country's chief volcano expert said Thursday.

entry.title: Lava explodes from Hawaii?s Kilauea volcano after crater collapses
entry.summary: Smoke and lava explode from Kilauea volcano on 's Big Island.

entry.title: Hawaii's Kilauea volcano eruption sends lava, rocks and gas into the air as crater wall collapses
entry.summary: In 1924, there was a huge eruption inside the volcano that doubled the size of the crater.

entry.title: Costa Rica international airport to reopen Tuesday after volcano ash cleared
entry.summary: SAN JOSE (Reuters) - Costa Rica's international airport is set to reopen Tuesday morning after the eruption of a nearby volcano blanketed runways with ash, forcing its closure overnight.

entry.title: Crater wall collapse sends lava, debris spewing into the air on Hawaii's Kilauea volcano
entry.summary:
HONOLULU - Molten lava and rocks went flying through the air on Hawaii's Kilauea (kih-luh-WAY'-uh) volcano after an explosion caused by the partial collapse of a crater wall.

The U.S. Geological Survey's Hawaiian Volcano Observatory says the collapse Sunday triggered a small explosion, spreading lava and debris around the rim of the crater.

entry.title: Rainfall in Area of Chile Volcano Could Cause Mudslides
entry.summary:
Authorities in southern Chile say rain over the weekend could cause problems related to the Calbuco volcano's eruptions over the last week.

About 6,600 people living near the volcano remain evacuated after Calbuco erupted Thursday.

entry.title: Rainfall in area of Chile volcano could cause mudslides
entry.summary: Thursday's eruption was smaller, but the National Geology and Mineral Service warns that more eruptions are possible and says the volcano could be spewing some ash and smoke for months.

entry.title: Lava lake on Hawaii's volcano overflows in spectacular show
entry.summary: But this past week, because of lava is rising inside the volcano, the lava lake rose high enough that it was visible, she said.

entry.title: Lava lake on Hawaii's volcano overflows in spectacular show
entry.summary: Janet Babb, a geologist with the U.S. Geological Survey Hawaiian Volcano Observatory, said Thursday that this is the first time lava from this vent has come into view from a public platform within Hawaii Volcanoes National Park on Hawaii's Big Island.

entry.title: Lava lake on Hawaii's Kilauea volcano starts to overflow its rim, drawing large crowds
entry.summary: HONOLULU - A lake of lava on Hawaii's Kilauea volcano has been rising over the past week and, at times, overflowing in a spectacular show.

entry.title: Chile's Calbuco volcano erupts again
entry.summary:
The area was evacuated after the volcano first erupted last Wednesday afternoon, but many people had begun to return to their ash-drowned homes.

"We're talking about a plume that is about 4km and that is directed toward the southern part of the volcano, so we shouldn't have major problems except for those who live in the south of the volcano and who will be hit by ash."

entry.title: Chile volcano Calbuco erupts again with new cloud of ash
entry.summary: SANTIAGO (Reuters) - Chilean volcano Calbuco, which erupted twice last week, began sending a new cloud of ash and gas high into the sky on Thursday.

entry.title: Chile's Calbuco Volcano Sends New Blasts
entry.summary: The Calbuco volcano erupted again on Wednesday, sending dark burst of ash and hot rock billowing into the air and prompting Chilean officials to order new evacuation of nearby residents.

entry.title: Chile's Calbuco volcano sends new blasts
Chileans brace for volcano impact on livestock, agro
Soldiers clear ash from around Chile's Calbuco volcano
entry.summary:
The Calbuco volcano, which had been dormant for more than four decades, had two huge eruptions this week.

The head of the National Mining and Geology Service said the volcano's eruptive process could last weeks and even months and warned that a third eruption was possible.

Soldiers help clean the yard of a house covered by volcanic ash from the Calbuco volcano eruption, in Puerto Varas, Chile, Sunday, April 26, 2015.

entry.title: Soldiers clear ash from around Chile's Calbuco volcano
entry.summary: SANTIAGO, Chile (AP) - Soldiers were sent to clear ash from towns and roads near Chile's Calbuco volcano, which was quieter but continued to release columns of ash days after emitting twin spectacular eruptions.

entry.title: Chile volcano remains unstable
Volcano Still Active, but Chile No Longer Fears Major Blast
entry.summary: Authorities downgraded the likelihood of a major eruption at the Calbuco volcano, although the mountain remained active Saturday and the ash clouds it already ejected caused cancelations of more airline flights.

entry.title: Volcano still active, but Chile no longer fears major blast
entry.summary:
He stressed that the volcano was likely to remain active and said more eruptions are possible.

Interior Minister Rodrigo Penailillo, who visited the area around the volcano about 620 miles (1,000 kilometers) south of Chile's capital, said the government would compensate farmers for losses from the eruptions.

More than 6,000 people have been evacuated and authorities are maintaining a 12-mile (20-kilometer) exclusion zone around the volcano.

entry.title: Volcano still active, but Chile no longer expects 3rd blast
entry.summary: At the foot of the volcano, authorities allowed some of the 1,500 people who evacuated the town of Ensenada to return temporarily to their homes to carry out belongings and clean up damage from the heavy ash fall.

entry.title: Chile volcano ash cloud reaches Brazil, flights cancelled
entry.summary: "The dangerous nature of volcanic activity like this plus the volcano's current instability that could lead to more intense activity in the short term indicates we should maintain the perimeter," Chile's national office of emergency said in its latest report.

entry.title: Chile Volcano Prompts New Evacuations, Flights to Argentina Cancelled
entry.summary: Television images showed residents in a town close to Lake Chapo quickly driving down ash-laden streets away from the smoldering volcano.

entry.title: Chile volcano prompts new evacuations, flights to Argentina cancelled
entry.summary: Most of the mines in top copper exporter Chile are located in the north of the country, far from the volcano.

entry.title: Chile volcano prompts new evacuations, flights to Argentina canceled
entry.summary: Some houses and schools located close to the volcano have collapsed under the weight of the ash.

entry.title: Ash piles up from eruption of Chile's Calbuco volcano
entry.summary: A woman holds a mask to her face as she stands with her belongings before evacuating the town of Ensenada, Chile after the Calbuco volcano erupted, Thursday, April 23, 2015.

entry.title: Ash piles up from eruption of Chile's Calbuco volcano
entry.summary: Ensenada, in the foothills of the volcano, looked like a ghost town but for an occasional horse or dog roaming its only street.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts anew; ash causing concern
entry.summary: Men remove ash from a building's roof, left by the Calbuco volcano, in Ensenada, Chile, Thursday, April 23, 2015.

entry.title: Flights canceled as ash cloud pours from Chile volcano
Calbuco Volcano Erupts Anew; Ash Causing Concern
entry.summary: As the ash cloud spread Wednesday, "people went into a state of panic," said Miguel Silva Diaz, an engineer who lives in Puerto Montt, a city about 14 miles (22 kilometers) from the volcano.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts anew; ash causing concern
entry.summary: A bus drives along an ash covered road, caused by the eruption of Chile's Calbuco volcano in Villa La Angostura, in southern Argentina, Thursday, April 23, 2015.

entry.title: Calbuco Volcano Erupts Anew; Ash Causing Concern
entry.summary:
President Michelle Bachelet declared a state of emergency, saying the eruption of Calbuco is "more serious and unpredictable" than the one last month at the Villarica volcano, which also forced the evacuation of thousands.

In 2011, a volcano in the Caulle Cordon of southern Chile erupted violently, forcing the cancellation of hundreds of flights and the evacuation of more than 3,500 people.

entry.title: Volcano Calbuco still erupting in Chile, some flights cancelled [Video]
entry.summary: SANTIAGO - Volcano Calbuco in southern Chile that erupted unexpectedly on Wednesday was still pouring ash into the sky on Thursday, forcing the cancellation of flights from nearby towns in both Chile and neighbouring Argentina.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts anew; ash causing concern
Calbuco volcano erupts anew; ash causing concern
entry.summary:
The Calbuco volcano is seen erupting from Puerto Varas, Chile, Wednesday, April 22, 2015.

Chile's Calbuco volcano erupted on Wednesday, spewing a giant funnel of ash high into the sky near the southern port city of Puerto Montt and triggering a red alert.

entry.title: Chile's Calbuco volcano erupts
entry.summary: The Calbuco volcano erupts near Puerto Varas, Chile.

entry.title: Thousands evacuate after Chile volcano erupts
entry.summary: He urged residents to evacuate and warned of possible lahars, a mix of water and rock fragments that flow down a volcano's slopes and river valleys.

entry.title: Emergency declared as volcano erupts
entry.summary: CHILE'S Calbuco volcano has erupted for the first time in nearly half a century, spewing a giant funnel of ash 10 kilometres into the sky and prompting authorities to declare a state of emergency.

entry.title: Chile volcano erupts for first time in decades
entry.summary: It is the second volcano in southern Chile to have a substantial eruption since March 3, when the Villarrica volcano emitted a brief but fiery burst of ash and lava.

entry.title: Volcano erupts in southern Chile, belching ash, smoke into sky
entry.summary: SANTIAGO - Volcano Calbuco in southern Chile erupted for the first time in more than five decades on Wednesday, sending a thick plume of ash and smoke nearly 20 kilometers into the sky.

entry.title: Chile declares emergency as Calbuco volcano erupts
Calbuco volcano erupts in Chile, and nearby town evacuated
entry.summary: SANTIAGO, Chile (AP) - The Calbuco volcano erupted Wednesday for the first time in more than 42 years, billowing a huge ash cloud over a sparsely populated, mountainous area in southern Chile.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts in southern Chile for first time since 1972; nearby town evacuated
entry.summary: SANTIAGO, Chile - Chile's Calbuco volcano has erupted for the first time in more than 42 years, and Chilean authorities have ordered the evacuation of the few thousand people living in a town a few miles away.

entry.title: Volcano erupts in Chile
entry.summary: Volcano Calbuco erupted on Wednesday in southern Chile, sending a plume of ash and smoke several miles up into the sky, local television images showed.

entry.title: Almost half Vanuatu people lack clean water, month after cyclone: UNICEF
'Volcano of Fire' spews colossal column of ash over Mexican city
entry.summary:
Mexico's Colima volcano has spewed a giant 3.5-kilometre-high column of ash that rained down on a nearby city, authorities say.

The Jalisco state civil protection agency said a "moderate" quantity of ash fell on Ciudad Guzman, a town near the western state of Colima, where the volcano is located.

entry.title: UN appeals for $20 million for Vanuatu cyclone victims
entry.summary: The cyclone's winds of 270 kilometers (168 miles) per hour devastated much of the archipelago on March 13, killing 17 people and leaving about 65,000 homeless.

entry.title: UN appeals for $20 million for Vanuatu cyclone victims
entry.summary:
UNITED NATIONS (AP) - The United Nations is appealing for nearly $20 million for victims of Cyclone Pam which tore through the South Pacific island nation of Vanuatu last month.

A U.N. appeal for about $30 million was launched on March 24 to cover the needs of 166,000 cyclone-affected people for three months but Dujarric said that to date donors have given only $10.7 million, just 36 per cent.

entry.title: Coney Island's Cyclone roller-coaster stalls on season-opening run
Coney Island roller coaster mishap briefly strands riders
entry.summary: Witnesses tell the Daily News (http://nydn.us/1IbCmov ) about 24 passengers on the first run of the Cyclone at Luna Park on Sunday were readying for the initial drop when it suddenly stopped.

entry.title: Ex-cyclone to cause wild weather in NT
entry.summary:
Ex-tropical Cyclone Nathan is forecast to cause wild weather across some parts of Northern Territory as it continues to move west across the Top End.

Early on Wednesday morning, the Bureau of Meteorology warned of damaging winds and heavy rain in the Arnhem and Daly districts as the ex-cyclone moved west.

entry.title: U.N. targets shelter, water in $29.9 million appeal for cyclone-hit Vanuatu
Cyclone crosses remote Australian coast near evacuated island
entry.summary: SYDNEY (Reuters) - Tropical Cyclone Nathan smashed into northern Australia on Tuesday bringing gale-force winds and heavy rainfall to one of the country's most remote regions.

entry.title: 5 things to know about Vanuatu's devastating cyclone
entry.summary: This aerial view of a small island in Vanuatu's north shows the extent to which the island has been denuded by Cyclone Pam, on Friday, March 20, 2015.

entry.title: 5 things to know about Vanuatu's devastating cyclone
entry.summary: Cyclone Pam transformed much of Vanuatu from a tropical green to a dirty brown overnight, as coconut trees were stripped of their foliage and snapped like matchsticks and even some mighty banyan trees were toppled.

entry.title: 5 things to know about Vanuatu's devastating cyclone
entry.summary:
People living on hard-hit Tanna and many of the other islands may have survived the cyclone, but they have no way of knowing how their relatives or friends are faring elsewhere.

Aid agencies, many of which were active in Vanuatu before the cyclone, have arrived in sometimes overwhelming numbers.

entry.title: 5 things to know about Vanuatu's devastating cyclone
entry.summary:
The cyclone has knocked down fruit-bearing trees and destroyed crops across the country.

The agencies do much-needed work by getting supplies to those affected by the cyclone.

entry.title: A week after Vanuatu cyclone, some homeless still await help
entry.summary: "People came in on the evening of the cyclone with their own food, water and whatever they need for the night of the cyclone," Regina said.

entry.title: Thousands wait for relief in Vanuatu as death toll hits 13
entry.summary: The cyclone wiped out gardens, killed livestock and contaminated the water supply in many areas, and agricultural experts estimate that those displaced by the storm will run out of food in less than a week.

entry.title: Australian cyclone makes landfall, loses strength
Cyclone Nathan makes landfall in Australia, losses strength
entry.summary:
SYDNEY - A powerful tropical cyclone was losing strength after crossing Australia's north-east coast on Friday, with no immediate reports of injuries.

Cyclone Nathan made landfall shortly before dawn as a category four system, the second highest intensity rating, and was expected to continue its westward movement inland while weakening, according to Australia's Bureau of Meteorology.

The cyclone is expected to lose much of its punch over land, but meteorologists warned it could reform again if it reaches the warm waters of the Gulf of Carpentaria, 250 km (155 miles) from the coast.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam rips through Vanuatu's Manua school
entry.summary: As Cyclone Pam ripped at the roof of Manua School, a group of men, women and children pulled desperately on electrical cable keeping them from harm.

entry.title: Cyclone survivors desperate for aid
entry.summary:
With power, phones and Internet still down across much of the country, officials faced logistical headaches in sorting out where to send supplies, particularly in Tanna Island, which was hit hard by Cyclone Pam's 168mph winds.

Many locals rode out the cyclone in larger buildings such as schools and churches - a practice that relief groups have impressed upon Vanuatuans as a life-saving measure during storms.

entry.title: Great Barrier Reef region braces for Cyclone Nathan
entry.summary: Northeastern Australia has battened down the hatches as it prepares for a strong cyclone forecast to hit coastal areas north of Cairns.

entry.title: Vanuatu after Cyclone Pam: Risk of hunger and disease rises
entry.summary: A young boy looks at the debris of his home, badly damaged by Cyclone Pam on the Vanuatu island of Tanna on March 18.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: At least eight Australians missing in Vanuatu
entry.summary:
Zoe Marshall was in Vanuatu when cyclone Pam devastated the region.

Eight Australians are among 19 volunteer teachers missing in Vanuatu, five days after Cyclone Pam tore through the Pacific nation.

entry.title: Food concerns mount in Vanuatu after monster cyclone
Fears of food, water shortages persist as relief groups rush aid to Vanuatu
entry.summary: Baldwin Lonsdale, Vanuatu's president, returned to his country on Tuesday night from Japan, where had been attending a UN disaster conference when the cyclone struck.

entry.title: Round-world fleet sails again as cyclone subsides
entry.summary: The Volvo Ocean Race's six-strong fleet finally set sail for the most daunting leg of the nine-month offshore marathon on Wednesday after the threat of Cyclone Pam subsided.

entry.title: Volvo Ocean Race boats depart Auckland after cyclone delay
Relief teams reach Vanuatu's cyclone-hit outer islands
entry.summary:
In this March 15, 2015 photo provided by UNICEF Pacific, a man works to recover from Cyclone Pam in Mele village, on the outskirts of the capital Port Vila, Vanuatu.

Adrian Banga surveys his destroyed house in Port Vila, Vanuatu in the aftermath of Cyclone Pam, Monday, March 16, 2015.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam lifts chance of El Nino this year in Australia, forecasters says
entry.summary:
The chances of an El Nino event, unusual warmth in large parts of the Pacific, have "had a real kick along" from Cyclone Pam.

Cyclone Pam's impact may not be restricted to devastating the island nation of Vanuatu - it may also have boosted the likelihood of an El Nino event for later this year, the Bureau of Meteorology said.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam lifts chance of El Nino this year in Australia, forecasters says
entry.summary: The chances of an El Nino have "had a real kick along" from Cyclone Pam, said Andrew Watkins, manager of climate prediction services at the bureau.

entry.title: Rescue teams reach cyclone stricken Vanuatu islands, official toll lowered
entry.summary: Relief workers were still battling to reach many of the islands pummeled by Cyclone Pam's gusts of more than 300 kph (185 mph) on Friday and Saturday.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Is it time for a category-6 cyclone rating?
entry.summary: The unusual strength of Cyclone Pam, which devastated Vanuatu over the weekend, may stir debate about the need for a category-6 rating for storms to reflect their increasing severity.

entry.title: AP Interview: Vanuatu President Rues Cyclone Devastation
entry.summary: Baldwin Lonsdale, president of Vanuatu, the Pacific island nation devastated by a powerful tropical storm last week, was attending a disaster conference in the Japanese city of Sendai when the cyclone struck.

entry.title: Vanuatu Struggles to Account for Cyclone Damage
entry.summary: Looking weary and red-eyed, Baldwin Lonsdale said in an interview Monday with The Associated Press that the latest information he has is that six people are confirmed dead and 30 injured from Cyclone Pam.

entry.title: Vanuatu president speaks of devastation from Cyclone Pam
Vanuatu president, heading home from Japan disaster conference, rues devastation from cyclone
entry.summary:
A: "Cyclone Pam has devastated Port Vila. More than 90 percent of the buildings and houses in Port Vila have been destroyed or damaged. The state of emergency that has been issued is only for Port Vila. Once we receive an update on the extent of the damage in the provinces then another state of emergency will be issued for the outer islands."

A: "This is a very devastating cyclone in Vanuatu. I term it as a monster, a monster. It's a setback for the government and for the people of Vanuatu. After all the development that has taken place, all this development has been wiped out. So it means we will have to start anew again."

entry.title: Cyclone Pam's aftermath in Vanuatu ? in pictures
Tropical Cyclone Pam hits Vanuatu
entry.summary: Surf pounds the shore as people walk among debris scattered by Cyclone Pam in Port Vila, Vanuatu, March 14.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Australia gives Vanuatu $5 million in aid
Cyclone Pam: 'It was like a velociraptor', as Australians survive Vanuatu cyclone
entry.summary:
A woman carrying a baby stands with children outside homes damaged by Cyclone Pam in Port Vila.

They face long queues, piles of debris and patchy phone reception - but two Australian television producers are thankful they survived Tropical Cyclone Pam in one piece.

While the worst of the storm lasted for just twelve hours, the cyclone has left a lasting mark on the people and infrastructure of Vanuatu, Mr Ang told Fairfax Media while he queued for petrol on the Kumul Highway.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam death toll to 'increase significantly' in Vanuatu
entry.summary:
RAW VISION: Dozens are feared dead as Cyclone Pam brings devastating winds, torrential rain and huge waves destroyed much of Efate and surrounding islands.

A Nasa satellite image of cyclone Pam as the eye of the storm passes just east of Vanuatu.

entry.title: Aid workers say 8 people confirmed dead after cyclone hits Vanuatu in South Pacific
Vanuatu president in cyclone appeal
entry.summary:
Unicef spokeswoman Alice Clements described the cyclone as "15-30 minutes of absolute terror" as it passed over Port Vila.

Have you been affected by the cyclone?

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Dozens feared dead in Vanuatu

Costa Rican Airport Reopens After Volcano Eruption
entry.summary: Smoke and ash spewing high into the sky from the Turrialba volcano led officials to cancel classes in a dozen nearby schools Friday and disrupted operations at Costa Rica's principal airport.

entry.title: Costa Rican airport reopens after volcano eruption
Cyclone Pam leaves swath of destruction in Pacific's Vanuatu
entry.summary: WELLINGTON, New Zealand -- Winds from an extremely powerful cyclone that blew through the Pacific's Vanuatu archipelago were beginning to subside Saturday, revealing widespread destruction and unconfirmed reports of dozens of deaths.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam Leaves Trail of Destruction in Pacific's Vanuatu
entry.summary:
A westward change of course put populated areas directly in the path of Cyclone Pam's 270 kilometer (168 mile) -per-hour winds.

The U.N. Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said there were unconfirmed reports of deaths in Vanuatu's northeastern islands after Cyclone Pam moved off its expected track.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam hits small Pacific nation of Vanuatu
Costa Rica reopens capital airport after volcano eruption
entry.summary: The Turrialba volcano erupted three times Thursday and state observers recorded a smaller eruption Friday morning.

entry.title: Small Pacific Nation of Vanuatu hit by powerful cyclone PAM
entry.summary: The cyclone has already destroyed some homes and caused damage to other Pacific islands including Kiribati and the Solomon Islands.

entry.title: Flooding, destructive winds as Cyclone Pam bears down on Vanuatu
entry.summary: He said they could be more destructive than Cyclone Uma, which killed at least 30 people when it sank two ferries off Port Vila.

entry.title: News24.com | Flooding in Vanuatu as cyclone hits with maximum strength

entry.title: Chile volcano sends spectacular pillar of fire into night sky (VIDEO)
entry.summary: "The volcano is quiet now, very calm. You wouldn't know anything had happened,"he said.

entry.title: Thousands evacuated after volcano erupts in southern Chile
entry.summary: SANTIAGO - Volcano Villarrica in southern Chile went quiet on Tuesday after an eruption that sent a plume of ash and lava high into the sky in the early hours put Chile on high alert.

entry.title: Villages evacuated as Volcano Villarrica erupts in southern Chile
entry.summary: Southern Chile's Volcano Villarrica has erupted, sending a plume of ash and lava high into the sky, and forcing the evacuation of nearby communities.

entry.title: Volcano in southern Chile erupts, thousands evacuated
Volcano in southern Chile erupts, thousands evacuated
entry.summary: The Villarica volcano erupted Tuesday around 3 a.m. local time, according to the National Emergency Office, which issued a red alert and ordered evacuations.

entry.title: Volcano erupts in southern Chile
VIDEO: Volcano eruption puts Chile on alert
Volcano Villarrica erupts in southern Chile, villages evacuated
entry.summary: The Villarica volcano erupts near Pucon, Chile, early Tuesday, March 3, 2015.

entry.title: Cyclone Marcia: Climate change is expanding the tropics
entry.summary:
Gold Coast residents are "scared of the cyclone", with more than 300mm of rain expected to cause widespread flooding.

Waves crash into a breakwall after Tropical Cyclone Marcia made landfall near Yeppoon.

While south-east Queensland and northern NSW have been hit by big storms in the past - including the "Great Gold Coast Cyclone" of February 1954 - it is likely such events were "hybrids or intense east coast lows" rather than cyclones, he said.

"It's pretty unusual for a category 5 cyclone to strike the coast of Queensland this far south," Associate Professor Walsh said.

Other big storms included a cyclone "very close to category 5" near Mackay in 1918 and Cyclone Dinah, a category 4 storm that stayed mostly offshore, Professor Walsh said.

The Bureau of Meteorology said the near-simultaneous landing of Cyclone Lam on the Northern Territory coast and Cyclone Marcia is the first recorded instance of twin severe cyclone events.
